001package io.jstach.jstachio.output;
002
003import java.io.IOException;
004import java.io.OutputStream;
005import java.nio.ByteBuffer;
006import java.util.Arrays;
007
008/**
009 *
010 * A custom OutputStream that is designed for generating bytes from pre-encoded output as
011 * well as reused <em>carefully</em> either by threadlocals or some other pooling
012 * mechanism.
013 * <p>
014 * If the buffer is to be reused {@link #close()} should be called first before it is used
015 * or after every time it is used.
016 * <p>
017 * This is basically the same as Joobys Rockers byte buffer but as an OutputStream because
018 * JStachio wants that interface.
019 *
020 * Consequently this code was heavily inspired from
021 * <a href="https://github.com/jooby-project/jooby">Jooby's</a> custom Rocker Output.
022 * <p>
023 * Apache License Version 2.0 https://jooby.io/LICENSE.txt Copyright 2014 Edgar Espina
024 *
025 * @author agentgt
026 * @author jknack
027 */
028public class ByteBufferedOutputStream extends OutputStream {
029
030        /** Default buffer size: <code>4k</code>. */
031        public static final int BUFFER_SIZE = 4096;
032
033        /**
034         * The maximum size of array to allocate. Some VMs reserve some header words in an
035         * array. Attempts to allocate larger arrays may result in OutOfMemoryError: Requested
036         * array size exceeds VM limit
037         */
038        private static final int MAX_ARRAY_SIZE = Integer.MAX_VALUE - 8;
039
040        /** The buffer where data is stored. */
041        protected byte[] buf;
042
043        /** The number of valid bytes in the buffer. */
044        protected int count;
045
046        /**
047         * Creates buffered stream of given size
048         * @param bufferSize initial size.
049         */
050        public ByteBufferedOutputStream(int bufferSize) {
051                this.buf = new byte[bufferSize];
052        }
053
054        /**
055         * Creates buffered stream of buffer initial size: {@value #BUFFER_SIZE}.
056         */
057        public ByteBufferedOutputStream() {
058                this(BUFFER_SIZE);
059        }
060
061        void reset() {
062                count = 0;
063        }
064
065        @Override
066        public void close() {
067                this.reset();
068        }
069
070        @Override
071        public void write(byte[] bytes) {
072                int len = bytes.length;
073                ensureCapacity(count + len);
074                System.arraycopy(bytes, 0, buf, count, len);
075                count += len;
076        }
077
078        @Override
079        public void write(byte[] bytes, int off, int len) throws IOException {
080                ensureCapacity(count + len);
081                System.arraycopy(bytes, off, buf, count, len);
082                count += len;
083        }
084
085        /**
086         * How many bytes have been written so far.
087         * @return 0 if empty, otherwise how many bytes so far
088         */
089        public int size() {
090                return count;
091        }
092
093        /**
094         * Copy internal byte array into a new array.
095         * @return Byte array.
096         */
097        public byte[] toByteArray() {
098                byte[] array = new byte[count];
099                System.arraycopy(buf, 0, array, 0, count);
100                return array;
101        }
102
103        /**
104         * Get a view of the byte buffer.
105         * @return Byte buffer.
106         */
107        public ByteBuffer toBuffer() {
108                return ByteBuffer.wrap(buf, 0, count);
109        }
110
111        private void ensureCapacity(int minCapacity) {
112                // overflow-conscious code
113                if (minCapacity - buf.length > 0) {
114                        grow(minCapacity);
115                }
116        }
117
118        /**
119         * Increases the capacity to ensure that it can hold at least the number of elements
120         * specified by the minimum capacity argument.
121         * @param minCapacity the desired minimum capacity
122         */
123        private void grow(int minCapacity) {
124                // overflow-conscious code
125                int oldCapacity = buf.length;
126                int newCapacity = oldCapacity << 1;
127                if (newCapacity - minCapacity < 0) {
128                        newCapacity = minCapacity;
129                }
130                if (newCapacity - MAX_ARRAY_SIZE > 0) {
131                        newCapacity = hugeCapacity(minCapacity);
132                }
133                buf = Arrays.copyOf(buf, newCapacity);
134        }
135
136        private static int hugeCapacity(int minCapacity) {
137                if (minCapacity < 0) {
138                        throw new OutOfMemoryError();
139                }
140                return (minCapacity > MAX_ARRAY_SIZE) ? Integer.MAX_VALUE : MAX_ARRAY_SIZE;
141        }
142
143        @Override
144        public void write(int b) {
145                throw new UnsupportedOperationException("expecting only write(byte[])");
146        }
147
148}
